title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.31 | 21-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Shri Mathe Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine Namaste Sarasvate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Paschatya Deshatarine Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from verses 31 to 32
of the 10th chapter of the first canto of Shri Madbhagavatam
So the 31st verse
The meaning of this verse is
While the ladies of the capital of Hastinapura were
greeting him and talking in this way the Lord smiling accepted their good
greetings and casting the grace of his glance over them he departed from the
city so the past few verses we heard the glorification of Krishna by the ladies
of Hastinapura in their talking amongst themselves when they had gone to the
rooftop to bid farewell to Krishna
so it is explained here Krishna accepted their good greetings and he cast his
merciful glance on them that way blessing them and he departed from the
city the 32nd verse
Ajatashatrupritanam gopi thaya madhudvishah
Parabhyah shankitathnehat prayum tacctur anginim
The meaning of this versus maharaj yudhishthira
although no one's enemy engaged four divisions of defense horse elephant chariot and army
to accompany Lord Krishna the enemy of the asuras or demons
The Maharaj
Yudhishthira did this because of the enemy and also out of affection for the Lord.
So Yudhishthira Maharaj, he is sending off Krishna and even though there is no need for
giving any special protection to Krishna, Yudhishthira knows Krishna is supreme personality of God
but out of affection for him, he arranged four divisions of defense forces.
Those days there used to be warriors on horseback, warriors on elephant back,
warriors on chariots and warriors on foot, foot soldiers.
So four divisions, horse, elephant, chariot and army,
what is called?
Horse infantry.
They were to accompany Krishna till he reached Dwaraka.
So it is explained that Yudhishthira Maharaj did this out of affection for Lord Krishna
because Yudhishthira Maharaj is a pure devotee of Krishna.
So Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport,
Natural defensive measures are horses and elephants combined with chariots,
horses and men, horses and elephants are trained to move to any part of the hills or forests and plains.
These horses and elephants are trained up to engage in fighting in a battle by the warriors or Kshatriyas.
The charioteers could fight with many horses and elephants by the strength of powerful arrows even up to the standard of the Brahmastra similar to modern atomic weapons.
So this particular science is lost .
In this present age, there used to be a division of the Vedas called Dhan experi dhanurveda,
Vedas called Dhanurveda how to fight with different weapons the skill for
fighting with weapons and some of the arrows that were discharged they were
having the power of mantra power of mantra that means the arrow when
released to go and strike a particular target by the power of mantra it will go
searching for the target wherever the target may be not necessarily the target
has to be in line with the the arrow being shot not necessary mantra by
mantra power it will go searching for the target
and they even had a very very powerful weapon called Brahmastra which is
similar to modern atomic weapons but the speciality of Brahmastra is it will go
and strike only the target it will not do destruction for mass destruction it
will not do unless the the Kshatriya who releases that Brahmastra desire so so he
can select a target and release the target and then the target will go
and it will be stopped and then it completely is Brahmastra and to only go
and strike that target and destroy that target only so that was the kind of
science Dhanurveda Maharaja Yudhishthira knew well that Krishna is everyone's
friend and well-wisher Krishna has no enemies because everyone is Krishna's part and parcel and he's Surdam Sarva-Bhutana he is the top master of thebhutaBhuta
most well-wisher of every living being so where is the question of krishna having enmity with anybody
krishna is everyone's friend and well-wisher but there are asuras who are by nature envious of
krishna envious of supreme lord is the demoniac nature demoniac nature is asuri bhava
so in this material world only not in the spiritual world only in the material world
there are two categories of beings created beings
in the 16th chapter of the bhagavad gita it is explained among created beings in this material
world there are two categories
daiva
and asura so how divine nature and demoniac nature now this is because uh some people
they wrongly think that krishna is their enemy they think krishna is against them
or somehow they have developed some
uh
iniquities
or they have developed some kind of feelings towards krishna
so yudhishthira maharaj out of fear of attack from others and also out of affection for krishna
he engaged all varieties of defensive forces as bodyguards of krishna
and also some vipassana verdigris also as a rickshaw or a bike rickshaw
and some of the other movements of krishna
now it is specially mentioned by prabhupada in the purport krishna himself was sufficient to defend himself from the attack of others
if required krishna himself could defend but still krishna accepted all the arrangements made by maharaj yudhishthira why because he could use it for his own good
and if you use it for the good of others he can't break his form as a demon because he cannot break his form but he can't break his form with this body
and if you use it as a weapon he can't break his form he can't break his form with this body
another example is this
other example is that for example the existence of god in the form of a demoniac
there are different形 Grinville kusama will take it as a demoniac
because he could not disobey the king who was his elder cousin. Krishna when he plays
the part of being a relative of a devotee, he plays the role perfectly. So he was a younger
cousin of Yudhishthira. So therefore, Krishna played that part, I am younger than Yudhishthira,
I cannot refuse. That is the etiquette. So I cannot refuse when Yudhishthira arranges
bodyguards for my travel, I cannot refuse it. So Prabhupada says, the Lord plays the
part of a subordinate in his transcendental sporting.
And thus sometimes he puts himself in the care of Yashoda Mata for his protection in
his so-called helplessness of childhood. Small child is after all helpless, totally dependent
on the mother. When it is just born, what is the condition of the child? The infant,
we do not even say child, we say infant, very, very, very small, just come out of the mother's
womb, totally helpless.
So we should not mistakenly think that Krishna is helpless when he is a small child. He puts
himself under the care of his mother Yashoda or Devaki as if he is a small child. But actually
he remains the Supreme Lord with all his powers, even as a small child. So therefore Prabhupada
explains that is the transcendental lela or pastime of the lord. Simply to give pleasure
to his devotees, Krishna enacts these pastimes. The basic principle for all transcendental
exchanges between the lord and his devotees, is exhibited to enjoy a transcendental bliss.
So, Krishna keeps enjoying these transcendental pleasures, Krishna is full of transcendental
blessings.
transcendental bliss and there is no comparison with this bliss even to the
level of Brahmananda. Krishna shares that transcendental bliss with his devotees
when he engages in transcendental pastimes with his devotees. So both
Krishna and the devotees are always in transcendental bliss. The thirty-third
verse, atha duragataan shaurihi, kauravaan viraha aturan, sannivartya
drdham snigdhan, praya svanagarim priyaihi. The meaning is out of profound
affection for Lord Krishna, the Pandavas who were of the Kuru dynasty accompanied
him a considerable distance to see him off. They were overwhelmed with the
thought of Krishna.
The Lord, however, persuaded them to return home and he
proceeded towards Dwaraka with his dear companions. Yudhishthira Maharaj has made
arrangements for bodyguards, four divisions of defense forces to accompany
Krishna till Dwaraka. But even the Pandavas themselves, Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna,
Manakula, Sahadeva also could not think of separation from Krishna because they are pure
devotees. All pure devotees are so. They are very intimately connected with Krishna
and therefore continuously thinking of Krishna only. Continuously. Such continuous thinking of
Krishna is a commandment of qualities of special prestige. Krishna is also the развит 좋은
is a characteristic of devotional service to krishna bhakti for krishna
krishna says think of me always so even if somebody is not a devotee if they
constantly think of krishna they become pure devotees they awaken their pure devotion to krishna
so uh because the pandavas were so intimately attached to krishna in pure devotional service
they went with him at quite a distance but then krishna sent them back persuaded them to return
home and he proceeded towards dhwaraka so very reluctantly the pandavas came back because
a pure devotee cannot bear separation from the lord
even for one moment and this will be explained later on in the descriptions of
the devotees of krishna how they feel when they are separated from krishna
i'll stop here thank you very much harikrishna
